Great story, even better multiplayer. Would recommend to, anyone really. It was really cheap in the Steam Summer Sale. ($0.99 USD) and Source Engine makes the game even better. Would recommend to ANYONE who either played Garry's Mod or the first Portal game. Grab a friend and enjoy!

This is probably one of the best games ever made. The level design is subperb, the story telling is fantastic and it doesn't disturb the game itself and the mechanics it introduces to the Portal series are super fun to use and really fit in. Not to mention the co-op mode. Really good game, would recommend.

This game is one of the best that I played. Good audio, gameplay and everything. I'm recommending very much this game. POTATO GLADOS.

This game is simply fantastic - it's the first valve game I have played and it was brilliant, when i bought the game i had little knowledge of why it was so critically loved, I thought likely it is for the puzzles - which do a great job balancing difficulty and satisfaction, especially later on into the story, but unexpectedly what had me loving this game so much was it's unique characters, interesting story and even the intriguing larger sci-fi universe only explained through pictures and voice messages. 

So much about this game was fantastic but the stand out part of that for me was the humour - I'm very rarely laughing at video game dialogue and until this game I had seen very few previous attempts at humour in the medium. But this game truly nailed it - from the overhead announcers brilliant lines to the sarcastic comments from Glados, or the somewhat slapstick humour from Wheatly - just truly a joy to have unfold in-front of me, and I enjoyed every line.

The length of the game could be criticised by some but for me it was a refreshing change of pace from a traditional 20 hour campaign, in-fact in odd ways it reminds me of Titanfall 2's campaign both excellent stories that tell so much in a 7-10 hour experience and leaving you wanting more information on what would happen next, but still fulfilling enough so that they don't rely on an unlikely sequel to satisfy the story.

Now is where it is important to mention the downsides of the game but to be frank, I found almost none significant enough to harm the experience, some issues for others may have been more significant but personally, I found the game to still look relatively good, it's physics engine and puzzles still feel intuitive and the controls are logical and easy to understand.

Overall, the game is a wonderful experience and I implore anyone else to purchase this game, if your reading reviews trying to decide - just buy it - it is simply fantastic, and deserving of its title as a classic.
